Integer and Fraction Digit Limits

+ * + * @implSpec + * When formatting a {@code Number} other than {@code BigInteger} and + * {@code BigDecimal}, {@code 309} is used as the upper limit for integer digits, + * and {@code 340} as the upper limit for fraction digits. This occurs, even if + * one of the {@code DecimalFormat} getter methods, for example, {@link #getMinimumFractionDigits()} + * returns a numerically greater value. + * @@ -3710,4 +3719,1 @@ - * number. - * For formatting numbers other than {@code BigInteger} and - * {@code BigDecimal} objects, the lower of {@code newValue} and - * 309 is used.
